com.inmobi.androidsdk
Class IMAdView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.RelativeLayout
              com.inmobi.androidsdk.IMAdView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
public final class IMAdView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout

IMAdView is used to load and render ads. The mandatory parameters for loading ads are App ID and Ad Slot size. This class can be instantiated either in the layout XML or in the program via a constructor. If it is being instantiated from the XML, ensure that you include the appId and adSlot attributes.

IMAdView

public IMAdView(android.app.Activity activity,
                int adSize,
                String appId)
Constructor to create an instance of IMAdView.

Parameters:
activity - The activity instance where the IMAdView would be placed.
adSize - The ad size. One of
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_300X250
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_728X90
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_468X60
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_120X600
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_320X50
appId - The InMobi App ID of the application.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If activity OR appId is Null
IllegalArgumentException - If adSize is Invalid OR appId is empty
RuntimeException - If InMobiAdNetwork and InMobiCommons SDK jars do not belong to the same SDK bundle

Method Detail

getAdViewPosition

public android.widget.RelativeLayout.LayoutParams getAdViewPosition()
Use this method to get the current adView position.

Returns:
Returns LayoutParams of the child views in dp. LayoutParams.leftMargin denotes adView's x-coordinates relative to android's contentView. LayoutParams.topMargin denotes adView's y-coordinates relative to android's contentView. LayoutParams.width denotes adView's width. LayoutParams.height denotes adView's height.

destroy

public void destroy()
Calling this method will close the ad, followed by destroying the underlying views.

isModal

public boolean isModal()
Use isModal method to check if the adView is modal in nature.

Returns:
Returns true if adView is modal, and false otherwise

IllegalArgumentException - If key OR value is empty

loadNewAd

public void loadNewAd()
Load a new ad into the IMAdView. Ad will not be loaded if the previous ad is currently being loaded or if the User Click event is being processed. A minimum of 20 seconds must be maintained between consequent success requests. Otherwise, the onAdRequestFailed method would be called on IMAdListener with ErrorCode.INVALID_REQUEST.

loadNewAd

public void loadNewAd(IMAdRequest imAdRequest)
Load a new ad into the IMAdView. Ad will not be loaded if the previous ad is currently being loaded or if the User Click event is being processed. A minimum of 20 seconds must be maintained between consequent success requests. Otherwise, the onAdRequestFailed method would be called on IMAdListener with ErrorCode.INVALID_REQUEST.

Parameters:
imAdRequest - The IMAdRequest instance with relevant values set.

setRefreshInterval

public void setRefreshInterval(int refreshInterval)
Starts or stops the auto refresh of ads. The refresh interval is measured between the completion(success or failure) of the previous ad request and start of the next ad request.By default, the refresh interval is set to 60 seconds. Setting a new valid refresh interval value will start the auto refresh of ads if it is not already started. Use IMAdView.REFRESH_INTERVAL_OFF as the parameter to switch off auto refresh. When auto refresh is turned off, use the loadNewAd() method to manually load new ads. The SDK will not refresh ads if the screen is in the background or if the phone is locked.

Parameters:
refreshInterval - The refreshInterval value in seconds, which cannot be less than 20 seconds.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if refreshInterval less than REFRESH_INTERVAL_MINIMUM

setAnimationType

public void setAnimationType(IMAdView.AnimationType animationType)
Set the animation between the ad swaps.

Parameters:
animationType - The animation type.

disableHardwareAcceleration

public void disableHardwareAcceleration()
Calling this method will disable hardware acceleration on the underlying views. Once disabled, it cannot be enabled.

public void setAdSize(int adSize)

Parameters:
adSize - The ad size to be set. One of
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_300X250
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_728X90
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_468X60
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_120X600
INMOBI_AD_UNIT_320X50

stopLoading

public void stopLoading()
Cancel the ad request. If ad fetch is in progress at the time of this call, an ad request failed callback is called with error (AD_FETCH_TIMEOUT)
If ad load/render is in progress at the time of this call, an ad request failed callback is called with error (AD_RENDERING_TIMEOUT).
Other cases does nothing
